title: Number Line
text: To think about this question, you might want to locate $$-5$$ and $$-2$$ on a number line.
speech: To think about this question, you might want to locate  minus, 5  and  negative 2  on a number line.
pacedSpeech: To think about this question, you might want to locate   minus, 5

title: Using Number Line to Reach Conclusion
text: For numbers a and $$b$$, when a is to the left of $$b$$ on the number line, we say $$a<b$$ (read "a is less than b").
speech: For numbers a and  b , when a is to the left of  b  on the number line, we say  a is less than b  (read "a is less than b").
pacedSpeech: , when a is to the left of   b
on the number line, we say   a is less than b

title: Answer
text: Since $$-5$$ is to the left of $$-2$$ on the number line, we say $$-5<-2$$.
speech: Since  minus, 5  is to the left of , negative 2  on the number line, we say  negative 5 is less than negative 2 .

on the number line, we say   negative 5 is less than negative 2
